intro: Veronica depauperata, commonly known as the poor man's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Veronica depauperata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
